channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report I-2024060038
item.description:
Report I-2024060038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: BISHOPVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FLORIDA TRANSFORMER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Due to force from acceleration or deceleration, a ratchet handle or a metal binder handle punctured the tote causing it to release its contents. The location of the puncture is thought to be about halfway up the tote. The duration of the release was along approximately 6 miles of highway. Emergency Response services were initiated, absorbent was applied to the roadway and traffic control was administered where needed. The trailer and any evidence of spillage was cleaned.

item.title: Report I-2024080005
item.description:
Report I-2024080005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: BARNWELL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ASSOCIATED PETROLEUM CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 158928
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Vehicle was traveling east on S-06-190 (Yenome Rd). Vehicle traveled off right side of the roadway, overturned to the right. the driver crawled to the roadside where a passerby found him. The unknown passerby called and reported the incident to 911. The dome lid of the #5 compartment leaked Jet A fuel 8 hours and 22minutes. Approximately 3,238 LGA leaked into a contained area on the ground. Pametto Wrecker Service and Terracon Consultants, Inc mitigated the release.
